articles.title: Pelosi concerned over Pence’s ability to handle coronavirus duties due to science-averse past
articles.description: In a press conference, Nancy Pelosi expressed concern over VP Mike Pence's ability to handle the coronavirus duties placed on him by President Donald Trump, and discusses his prior handling of a HIV epidemic in Indiana.

articles.description: Dr. Matt McCarthy, author of "Superbugs: The Race To Stop an Epidemic," discusses coronavirus-related drug shortages with Stephanie Ruhle. "We're just starting to see the tip of the iceberg with this," he says. "Things are not fine."

articles.title: U.S. braces for more coronavirus cases
articles.description: The coronavirus has caused people to ask a lot of questions, but what about when the answers are wrong? NBC's Dylan Byers and infectious disease specialist Dr. Matt McCarthy join Stephanie Ruhle to discuss the importance of the truth, but only if you hear it.

articles.title: Trump team's coronavirus rhetoric at odds with scientists and health experts
articles.description: The Trump White House's upbeat response to the coronavirus health scare is directly at odds with the federal government's own scientists and health experts.

articles.title: Dow drops 800 at open, extending worst week since financial crisis

articles.title: Long list of tasks awaits would-be managers of coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Dr. Ezekiel Emanuel, former Obama health policy adviser, talks with Rachel Maddow about some of the steps that would be taken by anyone wishing to properly manage the preparation and response to the potential spread of coronavirus in the United States.

articles.title: Trump's handling of coronavirus 'could go off the rails'
articles.description: Philip Rucker of The Washington Post reports his sources inside the White House say aides are concerned with how Trump will handle the delicate response needed to a public health scare like coronavirus.

articles.title: Psychiatrist on Trump’s ‘dangerous’ response to coronavirus crisis
articles.description: Dr. Lance Dodes, a contributor to bestselling “Dangerous Case of Donald Trump,” tells Lawrence O’Donnell that President Trump is a “con man” who is making the current public health crisis “all about himself”- which could have grave results for Americans.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Is Trump team's coronavirus response making things worse on Wall Street?
articles.description: Stock markets hate uncertainty. So we discuss with NBC News Sr. Business Correspondent Stephanie Ruhle how the confused coronavirus messaging from the Trump administration could be making things worse for investors.

articles.title: NYT: Whistleblower says US workers responding to coronavirus lacked training, gear

articles.title: Sen. Durbin: We should be realistic about coronavirus

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump, Pence give mixed messages on partisanship, virus response
articles.description: Both the president and vice president have delivered seemingly contradictory messages this week on partisanship and responding to the growing threat of the coronavirus. So, which message should the country heed?

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Mike Bloomberg: I believe Sanders would lose to Trump
articles.description: In an MSNBC exclusive, 2020 Democratic candidate Mike Bloomberg talks with Kasie Hunt about why he says the U.S. shouldn't trust Trump to handle the coronavirus crisis and why he says if Sen. Sanders gets the nomination, he will lose to Trump.

articles.title: A line on the coronavirus outbreak Trump may come to regret
articles.description: Trump explicitly said the total number of U.S. coronavirus cases will soon go from 15 to "close to zero." That's dangerously untrue.

articles.title: White House's Mulvaney: Coronavirus coverage 'all about' hurting Trump
articles.description: As far as the acting White House chief of staff is concerned, coronavirus coverage is "all about" an elaborate attempt to undermine Trump.
articles.content: Rush Limbaugh this week told his audience that "this coronavirus thing" is being "weaponized as yet another element to bring down Donald Trump." He added, "I'm dead right on this. The coronavirus is the common cold, folks." A day later, the host kept this goi… [+2543 chars]

articles.author: Msnbc
articles.title: Trump says he can reassemble a health security team quickly (he can't)
articles.description: After disbanding his global health security team, Trump says he can reassemble it quickly. It'd be great if that were true, but it's not.
articles.content:
As the federal response to the coronavirus outbreak continues to take shape, among the most important recent reports on the issue is thisForeign Policy piece from a month ago, which said the United States "has never been less prepared for a pandemic."
